website_summaries.verdict: A good, effective choice for survival kits, this set of 2 bags is also an inexpensive option.
pros: Comes 2-to-a-box, each with its own carry bag
Constructed of durable double-sided Mylar material
cons: On the small side, so it's not really built for larger people
Some complaints that there are no zippers or cushioning with these

customer_reviews.title: Compact, convenient, and multiple uses
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is double-sided mylar, so it is effective at reflecting heat both inward and away. Southern California is an irrigated desert and major fire country. I figure if I ever need to break these out, they will potentially be effective at keeping us cooler in the daytime and could offer minimal protection from intense heat to car passengers while escaping fire. The reflective surface is better for signaling help at longer distances than orange. I put one in each go bag for our family.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Extremely useful when I went to Mt
customer_reviews.text: Extremely useful when I went to Mt. Everest Base Camp. My only complaint is that they are extremely noisy. Not something you'd worry about in an emergency survival situation but I was just using mine to fortify the blankets at the under-insulated guest house I was staying at so the rustling kept waking me up.
customer_reviews.author: SC168

customer_reviews.title: Hope to never need them
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully I will never need these. They were recommended by a friend on our local fire department. They are good size, reflective on both sides, heavier than some of the others I’ve seen, I like the bright yellow on the edges for visibility.
customer_reviews.author: Living in the rain

customer_reviews.title: Good emergency mylar bag
customer_reviews.text: Got one as a gift and kept one for myself. I've used Mylar emergency blankets in the past. They shred far too easily. The Leberna tested well and did not desintigrate at the first opportunity like the others. I would buy this again and definately give them as gifts to my outdoor friends. Great price, solid quality, much better than average durability. Everyone needs to carry liht weight survival/emergency gear. This one is one of mine.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: A 'just in case' necessity.
customer_reviews.text: They seem like exactly what you'd expect for an emergency sleeping bag. It's a mylar sleeping. Each comes nicely contained in a bag for easy storage. Hopefully you'll never need to use it, but if you do, you'll be glad you have it.
customer_reviews.author: Strictly Value

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I hope little Timmy grew taller. But in earnest I got this as a back up to my emergency gear while hiking the PCT and around the eastern Sierra's. To date I haven't tried it yet, however it's more robust than my current milar blankets which this is replacing/complementing and it's a good weight for a go bag,and light (not ultra light) backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: D.R. salgad

customer_reviews.title: arrived on time
customer_reviews.text: I havent used them yet as they are in the car for emergencies but they look great and packed small enough to go in the side pocket of the door
customer_reviews.author: sho2kan1

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: Well thankfully I haven't had to use them yet however I think they'll work great typical space blanket material
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our To Go bags
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and perfect. Haven't had to use it yet, but sure it will work out.
customer_reviews.author: A. Holt

customer_reviews.title: Goes in my "Go Bag"
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and compact, exactly what I need in my emergency bag. Being able to get inside the bag makes this one useful for those wet, rainy days.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wise

customer_reviews.title: Best buy
customer_reviews.text: The emergency bags are rugged enough for reuse if needed but are one of the best things to have in your vehicle for emergencies like getting snowed in on the highway in the Winter as has happed in the midwest recently. They are cheap enough to have in as many vehicles as you own. Best Buy!
customer_reviews.author: JACKIEH2OS

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This emergency sleeping bag is going in my family emergency bag. I inspected the product upon receiving it. I unfurled the sleeping bag, and I tugged and stomped on it. I know that sounds funny, but I wanted to see if it's durable. I must say that I am very satisfied with my purchase. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Missy Jay

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and compact easy to find a place for them.
customer_reviews.text: It Is all I expected I have them in my bug out bag and my get home bag.
customer_reviews.author: cruz haro

customer_reviews.title: Survival sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful survival gear, small and eady to carry. Very light to carry. I would do business with this vendor again

customer_reviews.title: Usable
customer_reviews.text: Great. One in my BOB and one in my car.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic buy, you can use them as emergency sleeping bag or body bags if needed?

customer_reviews.title: Looks good enough
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully I will never have to try these things out. Look good and small though.

customer_reviews.title: Toasty warm
customer_reviews.text: If your Camping in the cold these are a must have, we sleep in these inside a regular sleeping bag in 30-50 degree weather. They are very toasty perfect.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Great for keeping in the back pack or in the car for emergency s

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery, very prompt. These are going in my car winter emergency kit. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great tool for a disaster kit
customer_reviews.text: What a great little survival tool for my disaster kit. Emergency sleeping bags can save a life when tragedy occurs and you just dont know when help is comming. This bag is a great size.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Just as described and I have no complaints at all. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Good bags - great price.
customer_reviews.text: Added to the bug out bags. Hope to never use them, but they are compact and seem like they would take a few uses if care is taken.
customer_reviews.author: FrankS

customer_reviews.title: compact size is a good thing, also you're wrapped up in it like ...
customer_reviews.text: Small, compact size is a good thing, also you're wrapped up in it like a ham sandwich. Not sure about getting it back in the stuff sack but that's life (literally).
customer_reviews.author: Keith J. Albertson

customer_reviews.title: Prompt delivery.
customer_reviews.text: The delivery was prompt and on time. They fit nicely in the go bag, and I look forward to not having to use them. If the occasion does arise I’m confident they will serve their purpose.
customer_reviews.author: jeff keesling

customer_reviews.title: Protection from the elements of nature.
customer_reviews.text: Protection from the elements of nature is one of the four for survival. This offers some of that protection.
customer_reviews.author: Dave J

customer_reviews.title: Wao
customer_reviews.text: And exelent item, the size is perfect. And the price amazing

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: i will use them in my boat excellent thermal properties

customer_reviews.text: I put this product in my car for if anyone in my city is living outside and needs warmth.

customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what I need. Compact and great cover will make it great to store in my car.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good product, keep 1 in my truck, and 1 in the wifes car

customer_reviews.title: Just a thermal mylar bag to keep you warm when you have to leave quickly without complete equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Very compact, expandable and storable emergency thermal sleeping bags for a 'bug-out' bag. Nice to have these sleeping bags in individual packs as they are shown. These items are only to be used for a quick exit when a disaster strikes and you can't take all the necessary complete camping equipment with you on a moment's notice -- not an actual full-sized sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Al Gregory

customer_reviews.title: ... received these on time as scheduled and they are perfect for our camping gear
customer_reviews.text: We received these on time as scheduled and they are perfect for our camping gear, to cover our sleeping bags against the elements, place them inside for extra warmth or for emergencies, in case of bad weather in our area. We did pull them out to see how big they were and then folded them up and had a few challenges placing them back in the bags, but we did it. We can always use the little bags for other things if the bags are torn or lost. They are perfect for the price.
customer_reviews.author: lisa colbert

customer_reviews.title: EDC in my backpack
customer_reviews.text: 1 in my back pack at all times and 1 in my wifes back pack at all times
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice for emergency use
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have for emergency(like when power goes down due to ice storm) or to have in glove box while traveling in winter. Not very expensive. Probably have to replace them after use. Better than freezing to death or frostbite. Fast delivery.

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully will never have to use but great to know its in your pack
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight. Hopefully will never have to use but great to know its in your pack.

customer_reviews.title: but they appear to be a good product!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used yet, but they appear to be a good product!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks good in and out of the package-I hope we will never have the opportunity to use it............

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product to add to my grab it and go ...
customer_reviews.text: I am thinking seriously about getting more of these for the many homeless people I see everyday. Awesome product to add to my grab it and go in an emergency bag/
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Harris

customer_reviews.title: it's better to carry a portable blanket
customer_reviews.text: This did not keep me warm. Don't be fooled into carrying this, it's better to carry a portable blanket, better still a real sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.author: NYCchap

customer_reviews.title: Safety first. Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I highly recommend this for everyone. **Living in california with all the wild fires and earthquakes it is necessary to have an emergency kit. I had been very bad at not having a kit for a looooooong time. And im proud of myself for finally putting one together for my husband and I. After getting married i realized "we" had to have something for us incase of an emergency. At my parents home we had emergency kits for everyone who lived there. I have been married for 4 yrs and i finally made kits for my husband and I. The kits i made should last 3-5days. I highly encourage everyone to have a kit
customer_reviews.author: M. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great for auto emergency kits!
customer_reviews.text: My family and I spend a lot of time on the road during the holiday season and are often far from home and family. I purchased these for our auto emergency kits and I'm quite thrilled we haven't had to use them! However, I've used identical products in the past and they are fantastic at what they do. Cheap insurance to make it out of an emergency
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M.

customer_reviews.title: These are compact, a plus for a go bag ...
customer_reviews.text: These are compact, a plus for a go bag, my intended purpose for the sleeping bags. Unfortunately, that also means I have no practical information as to their efficacy!
customer_reviews.author: Privacy1

customer_reviews.title: Must have for outdoor camping/hiking/survival kits
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loves it! It is compact which is awesome and doesn't take up space in his pack. Thank you!

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Not only do you get two but they can fit in the glovebox. Feel ready if the need arises.

customer_reviews.title: A critical addition to any Bug Out Bag!
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this product. As an author and speaker on 'church disaster preparedness', the quality and function of this product make it a strong candidate for any Bug Out Bag.

customer_reviews.title: Simple yet effective necessity in an emergency
customer_reviews.text: Very compact easily carried exactly what's needed in an emergency situation.
customer_reviews.author: a good book very helpful

customer_reviews.title: It’s Not Been Used Yet
customer_reviews.text: So my review means almost nothing but it came on time and at a great price.

customer_reviews.title: its really a good emergency sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to find out if using this will help me with wifi signals that I am sensitive to.

customer_reviews.title: Prorably okay product, but misleading promotional picture.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be adequate, but will know better if and when I have to use. The picture on the package is misleading - shows what must be a two foot tall girl totally enveloped inside a huge bag, which is in reality only three feet wide. And three feet wide is not enough for a lot of people, let alone wearing protective gear. This makes me worry about the durability of the item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Emergency Sleeping Bags
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could review it, but I have no intention of taking them out and opening them up unless I actually need them. Sorry.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product! Best price!
customer_reviews.text: This item met my expectations and then some. Totally worth the price. Had zero problems with this product! 10/10!

customer_reviews.text: Have not taken them out to try one but expect them to function in an emergency which is what they are for.

customer_reviews.text: The product is good! Somehow bulky. Be aware of that if you're looking for something ultra portable.

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a great option for inexpensive emergency shelters.
customer_reviews.text: compact and light. I expect they are for single use only. Should be one item that stays in your day pack or overnight pack even if you have a sleeping bag. large enough to fit over a sleeping bag to keep it dry if needed. An emergency is always an unexpected event. If I ever use it i will update the review, or if they degrade to be unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Joe L.

customer_reviews.title: Small easy to carry for emergency stay in the car
customer_reviews.text: Small easy to carry for emergency stay in the car. Mountain roads can be unforgiving and you may need to self sustain for a day.

customer_reviews.title: Not very big!
customer_reviews.text: O K, but only for little people. My12 yr old grandson just barely gets in it, then it ripped while he was exiting, so keep a roll of heavy tape handy.

customer_reviews.title: Carry in my GO BAG
customer_reviews.text: Bought these mylar sleeping bags to stash in my GO BAG. So I haven't used them yet, but I am confidant they will work fine if and when I need them.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars

customer_reviews.text: Packed away for preparedness kit. Takes up no space but could save a life. Everyone needs these and combined with mylar blankets, few weather issues a least for the short term! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mingo

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared
customer_reviews.text: Winter is coming, lights do go out, and it can get way below zero in this part of the world. I keep one in the car, and one by the bed.

customer_reviews.title: Bug out basics
customer_reviews.text: Hope to never need them, but comforting to have them available

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Has no cushion or support. No zippers. Can't block rain or snow. Can't keep you warm and didn't get all my money back.

product_meta.title: Leberna Thermal Emergency Sleeping Bag Mylar Survival Gear Foil Bivy Sack Shelter Supply | 3 x 7 FT 36"x84" Double Sided, All Weather Condition NASA Space Outdoors Camping Hiking Marathon First Aid
feature_bullets: Losing body heat is a major cause of death in emergency. The Leberna Emergency Survival Mylar Thermal Sleeping Bag can increase your chances of survival in all weather, all seasons and all circumstances. It is made of durable insulating Mylar material designed by NASA for space exploration. It retains / reflects back 90% of body heat. It is Reusable, waterproof and windproof.

The Leberna Emergency Survival Mylar Thermal Sleeping Bag is extra large in size, 84 inches in length and 36 inches in width. It has a bright yellow strip on the edge for high visibility. It is intended as an emergency shelter, but it is also great for camping, hiking, and protection from the cold outdoors.

The Leberna Emergency Survival Mylar Thermal Sleeping Bag comes with two packs in one box. Each pack has its own carry bag with draw string. Each pack weight only 2.8 oz (3.0 oz with the carry bag). Each pack is 7 inches by 3 inches. It is very light weight and easy to carry and store in your car, back pack or in your emergency kit.
Buy with confidence because all Leberna products come with a 30 day, 100% satisfaction, money back guarantee, no questions asked.

For customers who have never purchased a Mylar Thermal Sleeping Bag or Blanket, it is very important to know that the Mylar material is very thin. It is how it is designed by NASA for space exploration. So even though the size of the sleeping bag or blanket is big, they can be folded into a very small size.
